question_details.title: Will the temperature reach 70 degrees F in Warsaw, Poland after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025?
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the high temperature in Warsaw, Poland (specifically the airport), as presented by [Iowa Environmental Mesonet](https://mesonet.agron.iastate.edu/sites/hist.phtml?station=EPWA&network=PL__ASOS), has a high of greater than or equal to 70 degrees Fahrenheit for any day after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Easter Weather Forecast: Warm and Sunny in Poland**
According to the IMGW, the Easter week (April 21-27) is expected to be warm, with temperatures ranging from 11°C in the Pomeranian Voivodeship to 16°C in the Podkarpackie and Małopolskie Voivodeships. The week is expected to be the warmest of April. Rainfall is expected to be higher than in previous years in most of the country, except for the Mazowieckie Voivodeship and southern districts of the Małopolskie Voivodeship. The last days of winter in Poland will be sunny and warm, with temperatures ranging from 9°C to 14°C on March 20. However, a low-pressure system is expected to bring clouds and occasional rain showers on March 21, with temperatures remaining between 10°C and 15°C. The weekend of March 22-23 is expected to be cloudy, with occasional rain showers and temperatures ranging from 5°C to 12°C. Sunday is expected to be slightly warmer, with temperatures ranging from 10°C to 14°C, but the temperature felt may be lower due to a moderate and occasionally gusty wind.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 05:39 PM
Source:[gazetapl](https://wiadomosci.gazeta.pl/wiadomosci/7,114883,31783214,sa-pierwsze-prognozy-pogody-na-wielkanoc-mamy-dobra-wiadomosc.html)

**Spring Weather Change: Warmer Temperatures and Rain Expected in Poland**
According to the Institute of Meteorology and Water Management (IMGW), Poland can expect a significant change in weather as spring approaches. The country can expect warmer temperatures and rainfall. 'From tomorrow, we can expect a new warming trend, with temperatures reaching around 17 degrees Celsius on the first day of spring in the western part of the country,' said IMGW. Higher temperatures will bring rain, which is expected to start on the weekend and last until the beginning of the next week. Additionally, there is a possibility of rain on the border of March and April due to the approaching Genoa low-pressure system. In the coming days, the minimum temperature in some parts of Poland may reach -5 to 0 degrees Celsius, while the maximum temperature may reach 17 degrees Celsius in the Lubusz region. The weekend is expected to be cloudy with rain, with a possibility of snow in the mountainous regions of the Carpathians. The temperature will range from 1 to 5 degrees Celsius at night and from 11 to 16 degrees Celsius during the day. The wind will be moderate, with stronger gusts in mountainous and coastal areas. The start of the next week is also expected to be rainy, with temperatures reaching up to 20 degrees Celsius in some areas.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 02:03 PM
Source:[wiadomosci.radiozet.pl](https://wiadomosci.radiozet.pl/Pogoda/gwaltowna-zmiana-pogody-zacznie-sie-juz-w-pierwszych-dniach-wiosny)

**Spring Weather in Poland: Sunny Skies and Rising Temperatures**
According to the Institute of Meteorology and Water Management (IMGW), the weather in Poland will be sunny until Saturday, March 22, with temperatures rising to 15°C in most parts of the country. However, from Sunday, March 23, there will be more rainfall. On Thursday, March 20, temperatures are expected to reach 15°C in almost the entire country, with the highest temperature of 15°C expected in the Lubusz Voivodeship. On Friday, March 21, which marks the first day of spring, temperatures are expected to be even higher, with 17°C expected in the Lubusz and West Pomeranian Voivodeships. According to IMGW synoptician Ilona Śmigrocka, 'The next week looks like it will be the warmest day on Friday, which is the first day of spring.' Temperatures are expected to remain relatively high until around March 25, with up to 18°C possible in western Poland. However, Śmigrocka noted that 'we cannot rule out the possibility of winter returning in April.'
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 01:01 PM
Source:[gazetapl](https://wiadomosci.gazeta.pl/wiadomosci/7,114883,31782092,jaka-bedzie-pogoda-w-pierwszy-dzien-wiosny-szykuje-sie-cos.html)

**Spring Weather to Bring Pleasant Conditions, but Rain Will Also Make an Appearance**
A high-pressure system is still shaping the weather in Poland, bringing a pleasant and rain-free atmosphere. However, in the near future, temperatures will rise, and precipitation will return. According to synoptician Damian Zdonek, 'We will be in a stream of warm polar-marine air.' Thursday will bring sunny weather across the country, with temperatures ranging from 10-11°C in the Suwalszczyzna region to 15-16°C in the Lower Silesia and Lubusz regions. A weak and south-westerly wind will prevail. Friday is expected to be sunny, with the possibility of large cloud cover in the north. There is a marginal risk of light, passing rain showers. Temperatures will range from 10-12°C in the north-east to 16-17°C in the south-west. A weak and variable wind will blow. On Saturday, a pleasant and sunny atmosphere will prevail, with temperatures ranging from 11-12°C in the Suwalszczyzna region to 15-16°C in the Lower Silesia. A moderate and gusty wind will blow from the south-east. Sunday will be marked by large cloud cover with passing rain showers in the south and locally in the center. Temperatures will range from 12-13°C in the east to 14-15°C in the west. A south-easterly wind will be moderate and gusty. On Monday, the sky will be overcast, but there may be clearings. Rain showers will occur throughout the country, with some regions experiencing passing rain. Temperatures will range from 12-13°C in the Suwalszczyzna region to 16-17°C in the Lower Silesia. A moderate and south-westerly wind will prevail.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 12:37 PM
Source:[TVN24](https://tvn24.pl/tvnmeteo/prognoza/wiosna-pokaze-swoje-przyjemne-oblicze-ale-wyteskniony-deszcz-tez-da-o-sobie-znac-prognoza-na-20-24-03-st8370029)

**Spring Weather Brings Changes to Poland**
According to the Institute of Meteorology and Water Management (IMGW), Wednesday is expected to be mostly sunny, with occasional moderate and large cloud cover in the north and northeast. There is a possibility of light rain or snow showers in these areas. Temperatures will range from around 6°C in the north and mountainous areas of the Carpathians to 9°C in the center and up to 11°C in the west. On Thursday, it will be even warmer, with temperatures ranging from 9°C in the northeast to 14°C in the west. The weather will remain sunny, with occasional cloud cover in the northwest in the afternoon. Starting on Friday, March 21, the calendar spring will bring a change in the weather, with a low-pressure system causing an increase in cloud cover and occasional light rain showers. However, the temperature will be pleasant, ranging from 10°C to 15°C. It will be cooler near the coast, with temperatures ranging from 6°C to 9°C. On Saturday, the cloud cover will be significant, with only occasional sunshine. There is a possibility of light rain showers. The temperature will be coolest in the south, center, and coastal areas, ranging from 5°C to 8°C. It will be warmer in the northeast and west, reaching up to 12°C. On Sunday, the weather will be cloudy with occasional light rain showers. The temperature will be slightly warmer, ranging from 10°C to 14°C, with cooler temperatures in mountainous areas, ranging from 6°C to 10°C. The perceived temperature may be lower due to moderate and gusty winds.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 10:11 AM
Source:[Kobieta](https://kobieta.interia.pl/zycie-i-styl/news-pierwszy-dzien-wiosny-i-takie-wiesci-co-z-ta-pogoda,nId,7933693)

**Sunny and Clear Skies Expected in Warsaw on March 19, 2025**
According to the daily weather forecast for Warsaw on March 19, 2025, the day is expected to be sunny and clear, with no cloud cover. The wind direction is expected to be eastern, with a speed of 2.2-4.4 km/h. The temperature in Warsaw during the day is expected to range from -0.8°C to 8.9°C, with an average UV index of 1.2. At night, the temperature is expected to range from 1.2°C to 2.5°C. There are no expected precipitation in Warsaw on this day, with an average humidity of 51.5%. The weather forecast is based on data from the Norwegian Meteorological Institute (MET Norway).
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 05:28 AM
Source:[FAKT24.pl](https://www.fakt.pl/wydarzenia/pogoda/prognoza-dla-warszawy-na-srode-19-marca-co-wydarzy-sie-w-pogodzie/s8zfj8l)

**Warsaw Weather Forecast for March 19, 2025**
Today, March 19, 2025, in Warsaw, the sky will be overcast in 0% of the area. The wind will blow at a speed of 30 m/s. This is significant because the actual temperature will be 11°C, while the perceived temperature, which takes into account the actual temperature, humidity, wind speed, and precipitation, will be 10°C. According to the principle, in winter, we feel a lower temperature than the actual one when there is a typical winter wind and high humidity. In contrast, in summer, we feel a higher temperature when there is no wind and high humidity, which is known as 'parasolność' or 'parasol effect' that occurs just before rain. The thermometers in our homes will show 11°C, while the perceived temperature will be 10°C. Will umbrellas be necessary today? The meteorological forecast indicates that there will be no precipitation, no hail, and no snow today. How long will the day be? The sun will rise at 05:42 and set at 17:47. The weather forecast for Warsaw is as follows. Are you satisfied with the forecast? Or does the weather ruin your plans for March 19, 2025? We have an exact hourly forecast from AccuWeather Inc for almost 60,000 locations in Poland! With our weather service, you will never be surprised by rain. Check the forecast on pogoda.onet.pl.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 04:01 AM
Source:[Onet Wiadomości](https://wiadomosci.onet.pl/warszawa/warszawa-prognoza-pogody-w-dniu-19032025/x0r6nlb)

**Sunny Skies and Mild Temperatures Expected Across Poland on Wednesday**
Wednesday, March 19, 2025 is expected to be a sunny day across Poland with temperatures reaching up to 12 degrees Celsius. The wind will be light, with moderate gusts on the north and east coasts. The humidity will be around 30-50% in the center, south, and west of the country, and slightly higher on the north-east coast. The weather conditions will be favorable, with a high of 9-10 degrees Celsius in Warsaw, 8-10 degrees Celsius in Gdańsk, Gdynia, and Sopot, 9-10 degrees Celsius in Poznań, 10-11 degrees Celsius in Wrocław, and 8-9 degrees Celsius in Kraków. 'It will be a great day,' said the weather forecast, 'with plenty of sunshine and mild temperatures.' 
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 19, 2025 01:04 AM
Source:[TVN24](https://tvn24.pl/tvnmeteo/prognoza/pogoda-na-dzis-sroda-19-03-pelno-slonca-i-nawet-12-stopni-st8369237)

**Unusually Warm Spring Ahead: Poland Braces for Heatwaves and Winter's Return**
According to the IMGW, this year's spring is expected to be unusually warm. Temperatures are predicted to be above the long-term average, with some models suggesting highs of up to 32°C. Arkadiusz Wójtowicz, a climate modeler, notes that 'it's going to be a battle with heatwaves, associated with mid-summer, and winter will also make an appearance.' Wójtowicz adds that 'episodes of cooling will be relatively short-lived.' The spring season may also bring significant rainfall, which could alleviate concerns about drought in Poland. However, the exact details of the weather forecast will become clearer in the coming weeks.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 18, 2025 02:40 PM
Source:[Super Express](https://www.se.pl/torun/tropikalny-upal-wiosna-do-tego-burze-i-snieg-pogoda-wprawi-polakow-w-oslupienie-aa-8Kv3-Jeg5-nwkD.html)

According to meteorologists, there will be no precipitation today, with 0 mm of rain, 0 mm of hail, and 0 mm of snow. The sun will rise at 05:44 and set at 17:45. **Warsaw Weather Forecast for March 15, 2025**
Today in Warsaw, the sky will be 67% cloudy, with a wind speed of 14.8 m/s. People sensitive to weather stimuli should be cautious of the strong wind. There are two methods to measure the level of cloud cover: visual observation using an 8-point scale, and using a nephelometer, a specialized device that measures the percentage of cloud cover. We use the percentage method for convenience. The temperature in Warsaw today will be 9°C, with an apparent temperature of 7°C. According to forecasts, there will be no precipitation today. Sunrise will be at 05:51, and sunset will be at 17:40. If you are satisfied with these forecasts or if the weather ruins your plans for March 15, 2025, you can check our detailed hourly forecast from AccuWeather Inc for almost 60,000 locations in Poland.

Source:[Onet Wiadomości](https://wiadomosci.onet.pl/warszawa/warszawa-prognoza-pogody-w-dniu-15032025/24fpe92)

**Spring-like Storms and Unseasonable Temperatures Expected in Poland**
According to the IMGW and wxcharts.com, a significant change in weather is expected in Poland. Arkadiusz Wójtowicz, a meteorologist, notes that 'the period of stable weather is coming to an end.' The forecast predicts 'spring-like storms with hail, intense rainfall, and even rain with snow.' Temperatures are expected to rise significantly, with 17°C in Małopolsce and 8°C on the coast. The second half of the week (12-15 March 2025) will bring 'unwanted meteorological phenomena,' including storms and heavy rainfall. Long-term forecasts suggest that April 2025 will be warmer than usual, with temperatures above 20°C in some areas.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 11, 2025 09:05 AM
Source:[Super Express](https://www.se.pl/torun/burze-z-gradem-wdzieraja-sie-do-polski-wielu-na-to-czekalo-znamy-daty-pogodowego-szalenstwa-aa-bbUX-it59-ezmu.html)

**IMGW Predicts a Hot Summer for Poland**
The Institute of Meteorology and Water Management (IMGW) has released an experimental long-term forecast for the summer of 2025. According to the forecast, temperatures in June and July will exceed the multi-year average. In April, the average temperature will range from 5.3-6.7°C in Zakopane to 9-9.9°C in Wrocław, with precipitation within the multi-year average, but slightly higher in the north-west and west. May will also see above-average temperatures (up to 14.7°C) and precipitation. However, the warm summer may lead to drought. The IMGW forecast predicts that June and July will be very hot, with average temperatures exceeding the multi-year average. In June, the average temperature will be around 18.2-18.3°C in cities like Kraków and Warsaw, which is about 1°C higher than the multi-year average. Fortunately, the forecasted precipitation is within the multi-year average. July is expected to be warmer and slightly more rainy. 'In IMGW-PIB, as well as in other meteorological centers around the world, the average monthly temperature/total precipitation for a given month is forecast in relation to the multi-year average for the period 1991-2020,' explains IMGW on its website. 'The 30-year average is sorted from lowest to highest, with the 10 lowest values indicating the average temperature/total precipitation below the norm, the 10 middle values indicating the norm, and the 10 highest values indicating the average temperature/total precipitation above the norm.'
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 10, 2025 04:05 PM
Source:[wiadomosci.radiozet.pl](https://wiadomosci.radiozet.pl/Pogoda/imgw-ma-prognoza-pogody-na-lato-to-nas-czeka-w-najblizszych-miesiacach)

**Sunny and Spring-like Weather in Poland on Sunday, but Cooler Air and Rain on Monday**
The weather in Poland will be sunny and spring-like on Sunday, March 9, with temperatures ranging from 12°C to 15°C in the north and 16°C to 21°C in the rest of the country. However, a low-pressure system will bring cooler air and rain to the region on Monday. According to the Institute of Meteorology and Water Management, the weather will be variable, with temperatures ranging from 13°C to 21°C and winds reaching up to 60 km/h in the Sudeten Mountains. In Warsaw, the temperature will reach 16°C on Sunday, with a gentle breeze from the southeast. On Monday, the temperature will be around 18°C, with a gentle breeze from the south.

**Unusually High Temperatures Not the Only Thing: A New Weather Surprise**
A unique week of weather is ahead of us, with an anticyclone dominating Poland, bringing us weather that would not be out of place in April or May. Not only will it be getting warmer with each passing day, but we can also expect a lot of sunshine. There will be many places where the sky will be completely cloudless for several days, but the lack of precipitation will become a problem in the context of the growing drought. This week, Poland will be taken over by a truly spring-like anticyclone, bringing us exceptional weather that is not common at this time of year. Monday will still be a cloudy day, but more sunshine will be visible in the west and south. The high-pressure weather will accompany us at least until the end of the week, with a large amount of sunshine expected. Until Thursday, clouds will be lingering in the north, but in many other areas, the sky will be completely cloudless. In the second half of the week, it will be the same in the north. Given the current length of the day in Poland, this means that the sunshine will last for up to 11 hours. It's worth using this time for outdoor activities. Considering the growing drought, the lack of precipitation will be a problem. We can expect a very dry week, with little to no precipitation expected in most areas. Only in some northern areas, there may be symbolic precipitation, not exceeding 1 mm. Additionally, we can expect a significant increase in temperature. With each passing day, it will get warmer, and the peak will occur in the second half of the week, when the mercury will rise to 15-18°C in many regions, with local temperatures reaching 19-20°C. However, the residents of the coast will not experience such high temperatures, with a maximum of 10-11°C expected. The perceived temperature will be lowered by a strong wind.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 03, 2025 09:47 AM
Source:[Onet Wiadomości](https://wiadomosci.onet.pl/pogoda/zaskakujaca-pogoda-w-kolejnych-dniach-wyjatkowe-cieplo-to-nie-wszystko/t1c9k4x)

**When Will Spring Arrive? Long-term Weather Forecast Reveals the Answer**
The Institute of Meteorology and Water Management (IMGW) has published a long-term weather forecast. According to the forecast, the average temperature in March is expected to be 1-1.5 degrees Celsius higher than the multi-year average from 1991-2020. The eastern part of Poland is expected to be exceptionally warm. The total precipitation in March is forecast to be 5-10 mm lower than the multi-year average. In April and May, the average temperature is expected to be 1-2 degrees Celsius higher than in previous years. The total precipitation in April is expected to be comparable to the multi-year average, while in May it is expected to be 5-10 mm higher. In the central and southwestern parts of the country, the average total precipitation is expected to be 10-20 mm higher than the multi-year average. The summer is expected to start with a warm temperature in June, with an anomaly of 1-1.5 degrees Celsius in most of the country. The average total precipitation is expected to be similar to that of previous years.
Original language: pl
Publish date: February 18, 2025 06:19 PM

**Is Spring Already Here? Surprising Weather Forecast**
According to the Institute of Meteorology and Water Management, the weather is expected to be very warm until the end of January, and the first days of February will also be warm, with a minimum temperature below 0°C. The warmest day is expected to be on January 28, with temperatures reaching up to 14°C in Małopolska. The central and southern parts of Poland will also experience temperatures above 10°C, while the north will see temperatures between 6-9°C. The weather is expected to cool down only on the weekend. The institute's long-term forecast suggests that February will have a higher-than-normal average temperature, but it may also be a month with frequent precipitation. March and April are also expected to be warm, with average temperatures above the long-term norm.
Original language: pl
Publish date: January 24, 2025 11:54 AM
Source:[rmf24.pl](https://www.rmf24.pl/pogoda/news-czy-to-juz-wiosna-zaskakujaca-prognoza-pogody,nId,7899021)

**Fog and Haze Expected in Most of Poland Today**
A cold and foggy weather is expected in most of Poland today, with temperatures ranging from 2 to 5 degrees Celsius in the east and north, and up to 6-8 degrees in the southwest and mountainous regions. In places with prolonged fog, the temperature may drop to around 0 degrees. The wind will be light, with occasional moderate winds in mountainous regions, coming from the south. In the Sudeten Mountains, gusts of wind may reach up to 70 km/h. Tonight, the fog and haze will persist, with temperatures ranging from -4 to -1 degrees Celsius, and up to 1 degree on the coast. In the Silesian and Carpathian valleys, the temperature will drop to around -5 and -10 degrees, respectively. Tomorrow, the weather will be variable, with fog and light precipitation expected. The temperature will range from 0 to 4 degrees Celsius, with occasional light rain and snow in the north. In Warsaw, the weather will be similar, with temperatures ranging from 4 to 6 degrees Celsius, and occasional light rain and snow. The wind will be light, coming from the south and west.

In Phase 1, initial probabilities were generally low, ranging from 5% to 30%, based on historical data and climate trends. Factors like climate change slightly increased these probabilities, but historical data showed such temperatures are rare in March.
